title: Does anyone have wrinkles?
content:
Hi all,

Might be a stab in the dark but can anyone suggest a font which could suggest wrinkles? As in facial lines? lol

 [‹ Color synesthesia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008041209/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42974 "Go to previous forum topic") [Great Type Resources? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008041209/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42799 "Go to next forum topic")
author: _woonik_

comments.content:
Helvetica and Bembo are pretty old and tired. Does that count?

_Thanks folks, I’ll be here all week…_
Great thanks ill check them out.. Im trying to produce an image about a man with wrinkly eyes. I might try using letters to make an illustration of his eyes. - Im a bit new to this!

Ah - the sound of the grease paint - the smell of the audience! The Borscht Belt awaits you James :-)

woonik, Once you’ve had you your fun with Helvetica and Bembo...

aftershock

Al Retto

Albatros

In alphabetical order, these are the first three distressed looking fonts in the fontShop collection of display faces. Keep browsing through until you see something close to what you are after, or try the same thing elsewhere.

-=®=-

rofl at James.

Bell Gothic has all those weird indents. Wrinkles are kinda like indents right? RIGHT?!

I was having trouble focusing my eyes this a.m., and read “Might be a stab in the dark” as “might be a slab in the dark”, so I started working on it. ;)

Cheers!

Great stuff- Preissig looks good- Cheers  
dberlow- im confused- u were working on what? or should i not ask? lol
